bibl.title: Letter from L.O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 16, 1925

div1.p: Howard informs Kean that he will forward his review of the Gorgas biography to the editor of "Science."

div1.head: Letter from L.O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 16, 1925
div1.opener:
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY
WASHINGTON, D. C.
March 16, 1925.
Col. J. R. Kean, U.S.A. (Retired),
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
I thought you referred to yourself the other day over the tele-
phone as “General” instead of Colonel. Perhaps my hearing is not as
acute as it used to be. I thank you for the note and for the reprint
which I am especially glad to have. I will send the reprint to Doctor
Cattell, the Editor of Science, as I think well of Mr. Felix Neumann's
suggestion. Doctor Cattell, however, has been in Europe, and I have not
learned that he has returned as yet. His son is editing the journal in
his absence, but, properly, does not wish to assume editorial responsi-
bility in any but the simplest cases. I will send a letter with the re-
print which I hope will give the elder Cattell seriously to think.

This is in answer to yours of the 14th. Could you spare me another
copy of the reprint, since I am sending this one away!
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard
Chief of Bureau. loh-wft
